WRITING.TEXT: Your title needs help. See all that space after the word "bundle?" You are missing vital key words to make your listing stand out in searches. Add keywords for each item in the bundle until you run out of characters. Remain honest in your title and description of course but think about what someone searching would put into the search box.

WRITING.TITLE: Your tip of the day
WRITING.TEXT: If you're going to be selling locally to Facebook groups for the love of everything good create a separate account just for that. It will avoid alerting friends in those local groups every time you list something and allow some measure of anonymity. That way people can message your alternate account calling you reseller scum rather than your actual account. :D
You check fb activity of every sale or fb purchase? Wish I had that kind of time to waste.
Good points but I value my relative anonymity more.
Not getting where the hostility is coming from. Unresolved anger issues? I've had no problems with sales.

Uh, yea don't do that. If you mark it as paid you're obligated to send it. If you don't send it he could open an item not as described or even received case against you. He would win. Fyi you should have just cancelled the bid. The guy was nice enough to message you before auction end. Not many buyers do that.
Yes, they tell you when to ship and yes you can buy a shipping label through them. Fyi though Amazon customers tend to be pickier.
http://pages.ebay.com/help/sell/manage_bidders_ov.html#canceling
I wouldn't say any reason but it feels like that at times. If they just changed their mind they should pay for shipping BUT do I feel more pressure on Amazon to cover return shipping if asked? Yes.

Each has it's pros and cons depending on the item. I sell on both depending on how quickly they're selling and profit. I didn't mean to scare you off the MF. Just be aware of the difference between ebay and Amazon customers.

I'm positive about it. Already have the preorder in. I think smart watches are trying to do too much for me. The blaze is a good balance.
Yea, not sure who make these battery estimates. My charge HR just makes 48 hours. No call notifications.
Interesting. I love the quick glance feature fwiw.
Already have that off as well.

I have the charge hr right now which is great but I do miss having text or calendar notifications. For that reason I preordered the Blaze. It's being bashed in the media for not having enough bells and whistles to compete with the Apple Watch but it has what I want. Apple Watch does too much to me.
Thanks! I'll try it out. I'm a little scared of what will happen to the charge hr battery though. How does yours do?
Me too but I'm assuming the size of the tracker also allows the battery to be bigger. Like comparing battery life in the iPhone 6 to iPhone 6 Plus. One can hope!

What a strange article of duh. Fitbit has made me become more active. I'm younger yes but Fitbit allowed me to see in black and white just how sedentary I was being. I don't want to die at 40 if I can do something to help it! Something about seeing my steps and calorie intake (mfp!) made things click for me.
Wow, nice resting heart rate! Mine is a very average 73.

Tl; dl. If you're anxiety ridden, neurotic, have inflexible thinking and feel you're being driven by data don't use a tracker. Listen to your body and have fun. (Duh) This is what happens when we try to apply ok psych research into a modern self-help pop psychology framework. Several major leaps from research to how it applies to our lives.
Also you can customize what shows up when you tap.
No. Awkward interface and few titles I care about. It's an occasional bonus but not standalone.
Ironic you should post this. Been on 10k streak since Dec. 21. It will most likely end today. Stomach bug. #128567;

I have an iPhone so I wouldn't know about the widgets available for Android. Just checking to see if you've considered the myfitnesspal app? It really is phenomenal for food logging and calorie counting.
Yup, that's what I was saying.

It could help depending on how your heart rate goes and how you respond to monitoring techniques. The technique you're talking about is called biofeedback. I'd recommend whoever is treating you for anxiety (if anyone) be part of this conversation.

Yea, I'd second using myfitnesspal (mfp). As an aside I think you're being too aggressive with your weight loss. I had similar stats. 6'2 and 250 pounds on Dec. 21, '15. I set mine to a pound a week of loss and exercise on top of that to act as a "bonus" for the calorie deficit. My goal is 2100 calories which is doable. I'm now 230 pounds and still going. Best of luck.

Yup, also don't trust the packaged conversions. If the package says 18 slices is 37g don't trust that 18 slices is 37g. Weigh it. I can't tell you how many times the estimate is off by a significant amount.
Get what you want but I wanted the charge hr to blend with what I wear and not draw attention to it. I went with black.
I also use mfp and Fitbit. Really they sync really well. The mfp database of food is waaaaay better than Fitbit.

WRITING.TITLE: Question about "healthy" weight loss
WRITING.TEXT: 32M 6'"1 SW:250 CW:230 GW:200 Desk Job with jogging/walking habit (thanks Fitbit!). So someone noticed that I lost some weight. I love that! When he asked how much I told him 20 lbs (9.072kg). He then said I looked good but just be careful not to drop too much weight too fast. I've dropped the weight in 6 weeks using myfitnesspal, Fitbit and c25k. This got me thinking. How much weight loss is too much too soon? And what makes it unhealthy? Just a note, I feel great! I don't feel hungry because I focus on protein and veggies. My calorie goal in mfp to lose one pound (0.45kg) a week is 2100 calories. I've been meeting that goal and using exercise as a "bonus" to my deficit. I don't eat beyond my calorie goal unless the deficit gets over -800 calories just to make sure I'm not starving myself. Is this dangerous? Eta: changed my brain fart conversions.
Brain fart. Thanks!
Thanks!
Yup, it has slowed and I'll have weeks where I only lose a pound. Thanks!
Thanks!
Thanks for the insight! Our goals are remarkably similar. It's helpful to see your experience.
Good tip, thanks!
Thanks for the support!
Congrats!

WRITING.TITLE: Hocking Hills, Ohio- Winter Hiking
WRITING.TEXT: Went out to Hocking Hills for some hiking with a buddy of mine. Had a great time there. I never thought that flatland Ohio would have some hidden gems like Old Man's Cave or Ash Cave. Only been in Ohio for about 8 years but I'm surprised I didn't know much about these places. I'm sure it's gorgeous in the summer, I just went in the winter. The paths were VERY icy though. If you have a chance you should check it out. We hiked around Ash Cave a bit then did the hike from Cedar Falls to Old Man's cave and back. My video summary of the hike: https://youtu.be/DCvYYj6ZqhM Anyone have any experience in the area? Is camping allowed within Hocking Hills State park? I think an overnight would be fun there.
Try heading down to the lower trail that runs next to the river, not the upper rim. ALOT less people because it was seen as more difficult in some spots. Especially with the ice.
Thanks, my friend wanted to check out rock house but we ran out of time just putzing around between cedar falls and old man's. I'll have to keep rose lake in mind too.

WRITING.TITLE: Super windy day Ozark Trail 8 person tent set-up. Yes, my tent and camera did fall over.

WRITING.TEXT: Dude, you just changed my life.

Ooh, good idea. I really wasn't expecting it to be as windy as it was! I laughed hysterically when the tent collapsed. Thanks for the tip. After laughing I turned to look at the camera. Which was on the ground. :) All is well though. When it warms up hoping to get the kids out in the backyard. #128077;
The northwest, south of Toledo. I do have some friends close to the PA border though so I'll have to check out and see the WV trails.

WRITING.TITLE: Quick set up of Ozark Trail 8 person tent

WRITING.TEXT: Super windy day. Yes, my tent and camera took a dive. Seems the tent will be a good backyard camper to get the kids into camping.
I wasn't sure what tag to put on since it's not a full review. I'm not really advertising it. Just a guy doing a set up.
Nice set up! How comfy was that foam pad on the makeshift bed?

I think they're right. The Fitbit app is one of the best parts of the experience. It's the major reason I switched to Fitbit after using a Garmin briefly. The app sucked and stopped syncing properly to myfitnesspal.
How much does it weigh?
Thanks, not bad at all!

WRITING.TITLE: My walk-through of my new backyard camping tent
My walk-through of my new backyard camping tent

WRITING.TEXT: Ok, pretty new to this. What were my incorrect facts? ETA: thanks for the link. I'll check it out.
Nice!

WRITING.TITLE: Got the backpacking bug I think. My first official "hike." Hopefully the first of many.

WRITING.TEXT: Ignore my yapping at the beginning. Start at 3:00 for the hike.

WRITING.TITLE: First official "hike." Hopefully the first of many. I think I got the bug. How did I not know how awesome this was?

WRITING.TEXT: Video of me on first official hike, Hocking Hills State Park, Hocking Hills, Ohio, USA. Ignore me yapping I was just excited. Hike starts at 3:00.
Nice! I'm in Ohio. I think the Midwest has a bunch of good winter options.
Yea, it's really gorgeous in the summer. Even more so in the winter I think.
Yea it's really amazing
How'd it do?
I know it, that's been one of the biggest things I'm learning is layering properly and wearing the right materials.

WRITING.TITLE: Wire mesh pot stand
WRITING.TEXT: Looking to make one of those wire mesh pot stand for my cook kit. Anyone have a source? I don't need a ton of it.
I should add I'm looking for stainless steel. My big box stores all have galvanized.
Walmart in the paint aisle. Denatured alcohol fuel by kleanstrip.

WRITING.TITLE: Enlightened Equipment weather resistant stripes
WRITING.TEXT: For those of you using EE gear. Are these stripes worth it? I'm close to pulling the trigger on a 20 degree quilt but I'm getting hung up on how these stripes would be worth it. Specific examples of how it's been handy for you would be helpful. Thanks.
Hmm, not seeing the option for full 20d. Maybe an email is needed before placing an order? ETA: nvm, I opened my eyes. Lol
Thanks everyone. Went with the EE 20 degree quilt. Chose the full 20d option. Ofc, I did spend all day debating the cost and weight difference between the 20 and 30 degree options. Ha!

WRITING.TITLE: A noob testing his sleep system gear in the winter.

WRITING.TEXT: Comments on choices or ideas for different gear welcome please.

WRITING.TITLE: Trying out my winter sleep system x-post r/camping

WRITING.TEXT: Cross posted to get some feedback on the overall system. Ideas and suggestions are welcome. Making sure I'm not overlooking anything.

WRITING.TITLE: Brief water test of my new boots!

WRITING.TEXT: I'm a fan so far of these boots! In addition to my water test (mostly to build confidence in the boots) I've now gone hiking in some very marshy mucky conditions and come away impressed by these boots. Salomon Quest 4d 2.
No prob! I'm new to the hiking scene and love them so far.
Thanks for the heads up. Ended up ordering one through Sierra trading post. Got it down to 160 shipped. Their colors didn't bother me. I got green.
Crap. :/ I'll probably reach 200 miles early-summer if I keep my current pace. I'll update then and the end of summer. Fingers crossed.

WRITING.TITLE: My daughter's first official hike with dad

WRITING.TEXT: Trying to raise a hiking buddy with little legs. She did well. I have to remember even a mile is a lot for her right now.
Nice place to grow up. Not too many hiking options unfortunately. Of course, it's not quite hiking season. People are shocked to see me camping out. Our local state park is also pretty empty.
Wow nice. Was just talking about this trail today.
Nice! Thanks for sharing.
It does get warmer with it on. What sold me on it is the fact that it has to be made to fit the hammock and you can't get it later.

WRITING.TITLE: My first attempt at an upside down fire. Tips From bushcrafters please.

WRITING.TEXT: Tips and comments welcome please. I think I have the overall concept down right. Anything I could do differently or that I missed?

Wow! Thanks for the detailed response! You're right I didn't pay much attention to the gaps. I'm heading out tonight and building another one so I'll be able to compare how it does. Seriously thanks for the "tutorial." I'm going to be heading out as much as I can and this is all fairly new.
I was able to hammock camp last night but no campfire. :( Storms rolled in fast so I got tarp and hang ready before the deluge. Just used an alcohol stove for something warm from the hammock.
I have seen the dirt mod before but never paid attention to the log length. Thanks for the tips. I go back to the "real world" tomorrow but will try the variations when I can.

WRITING.TITLE: Seam sealing warbonnet big mamajamba
WRITING.TEXT: Just a quick question for those who have sealed the pullouts for this tarp. Warbonnet instructions say to just seal the underside of the tarp and just the thread. I did this a few days ago and tested it today in the rain. HUGE no go. All four pull outs leaked. Bad news. Should I just seal the outside seams as well and test again? What am I missing? I'm using sil-net.

WRITING.TITLE: Seam sealing warbonnet big mamajamba x-post r/ hammocks
WRITING.TEXT: Just a quick question for those who have sealed the pullouts for this tarp. Warbonnet instructions say to just seal the underside of the tarp and just the thread. I did this a few days ago and tested it today in the rain. HUGE no go. All four pull outs leaked. Bad news. Should I just seal the outside seams as well and test again? What am I missing?

WRITING.TITLE: This is hilarious. Wanted to share.

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks!
Thanks!
Thanks, I'll do the outside as well.
Just finished sealing up with sil-net. Water hose test to follow in 2 days. #128077;
Tested just now with the hose. Worked perfectly! Thanks again!

WRITING.TITLE: Seam sealing Warbonnet Big Mamajamba

WRITING.TEXT: Posted a question about seam sealing my tarp a little bit ago. Just a heads up you need to seam seal both underside and top side of this tarp by the pullouts. Warbonnet says to only do the underside. That DID NOT work at all. Leaked like a sieve when I tested it out. I let it dry out and did the top side and that worked well.
Others have said already but I put a pad for insulation between the layers. Also I think by having a dual layer it increases the weight rating of the hammock.
Thanks for your help. Because of you my kids didn't get wet when I sat them under the tarp and sprayed it. Ha!
Yup I did. Another hobby and it's fun to vlog.
Thanks! I'll keep that mind for my next Warbonnet purchase. #128077;
Ha, that was a fun watch!

WRITING.TITLE: Van Buren State Park, Ohio hike

WRITING.TEXT: Just a local quick trip. I'm lucky to have options so close by. Trying to condition myself to get into shape for summer.
In the shelf of my blackbird. In a holster.

WRITING.TITLE: This might be the best video on the internet today. I'm not affiliated with these guys but I'm a huge fan.

WRITING.TEXT: Got the design plan from gossamer gear. Need to test it out. Came across it after a rainy night under a silnylon tarp.

WRITING.TITLE: Outdoor stuff!

WRITING.TEXT: Ha! Nicely done.
Exactly this.
Wow, that is creative.
Thanks. Wasn't sure about the longevity of the clove hitch. I appreciate the field experience.
I used the clove hitch to secure the shock cord to the guy lines in the video. I'm just new to knots so wasn't sure it was the best for the task.
Good point. I may just do that.
The only reason I can think of is it obstructs people walking or running on the beach. And that's a a stretch.
Not necessary for me with a hammock. Depends on how you sleep I'd guess.
Very nice!
That does not seem worth it...at all. I'd rather carry a battery for charging.
I use a Kmashi 15000 mAh. Has worked well for me so far.
Nice. I camped out Wednesday night. It rained all night and these worked prefectly. No tarp on my face and sure enough the tensioners did take up the slack.

WRITING.TITLE: Zerogram ultralight poop trowel. Decent option instead of using a stick. Only 1oz.

WRITING.TEXT: Amazing how light this is, the big drawback is how short the handle is unfortunately.
Lol. Good point.
Isn't that really hard on the edge though?
A timely reminder. I'll be doing my permethrin soak in a few days. #128077;
Good choice. I went with the mamajamba instead of the superfly.
I'm more of a three season camper right now. Didn't need the doors or the overall size. If I do winter camping I'd either get the door kit for the mamajamba or most likely pick up the superfly.

I'd go with Hennessy posted, it's a good option. Although I have considered the aqua quest guide. I convinced my friend to get one and he's a fan. Provides good coverage and not hex shaped. http://www.amazon.com/Aqua-Quest-Guide-Sil-Tarp/dp/B004RVHBLO/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8 amp;qid=1462024392 amp;sr=8-1 amp;keywords=Aqua+tarp
That sounds awesome

WRITING.TITLE: Cheap and easy rocket stove. Costs nothing if you use old bricks.

WRITING.TEXT: You have excellent taste sir. I have the xlc and the mamajamba. Great combo of you work towards that.
I like Nathan4071 ferro rods on eBay. He also has a YouTube channel I follow.

I'm split on this. I love the individuality bright colors bring but not the attention. For this reason the outside visible part of my gear is earth tone all the way. Inside all bets are off. To give an example...my EE quilts are earth tone outside and orange or red on the inside. My way of having fun with it. #128513;
I know the feeling man.
I feel you. Luckily I ordered in early March. Hoping to have mine by the end of May. Hammock gear, jacks r better and haunting the EE site looking for a ready made quilt are things I considered.
Decent review. Raised some points that made me cancel my preorder and still hesitant to purchase.
Lol, cheaters.
Ha, I don't think you're the only one.
Good first hammock I think. First post above is very good and covered most everything.
I got the 20 degree because of its versatility. Should be fine from 50s on down.
Same, it's been coming and going the last couple days.
You might be overthinking this. :)

Lol, at least you're good natured about it. I think there's something to be said about calming colors instead of something shockingly fluorescent. I actually try to make the outer part of my gear (quilts etc.) to be earth tone and the inner part to be a fun color. Never thought about it's impact on my sleep though...

WRITING.TITLE: Woot! Hammocks are taking over!

WRITING.TEXT: Buff.
Immersing yourself in nature refreshes the soul. Backpacking allows me to immerse myself further and deeper than any car camping experience.
Congrats!
Thanks for asking the question. Lots of great info in this thread.
Thanks! Hammock camping has really changed my perspective on sleeping outside.
Would be nice. Haven't heard of it but thanks for asking.
You stay dry? I love the sound of rain on the tarp.
Manual. Usually lighter.

WRITING.TITLE: How to stop ticks when you're in the bush

WRITING.TEXT: I'm assuming it would drain the battery.
I wish it were warmer here. Nice pic btw.
I went with the OR helium ii. So far so good. The OR customer service is what swayed me over marmot.
Hydrate well is goal 1 I'd think. Light colored clothing will be helpful too.
Another thumbs up for the warbonnet.
That's way less than its supposed to be. Even with bad battery life.
Wha?

Yea, they work well for me but I much prefer the Sawyer squeeze. I see a bunch of comments suggesting the mini but I've seen first hand the problems the mini has with flow rate even after backflushing.
Ordered 3/1 and still waiting...
Lol, ofc got my shipping email today. :)

WRITING.TITLE: EMSK How to build the Dakota fire hole

WRITING.TEXT: Yes you're absolutely right. I mention that in the video. For heat an above ground makes the most sense. #128077;
Hahaha! I lived in Pueblo for a bit so I totally understand.
Haha! Thanks. The grass has already grown back since I did this and my wife didn't notice till I told her.
I've seen this guy's video before and it's super helpful. Thanks for sharing.
Unless price is the major issue why not just stick with warbonnet? I have the exact hammock and use the big mamajamba. Excellent all around.
Most definitely. I love it paired with the xlc. The only drawback if you can call it that is that you do have to seam seal the pullouts.
That's awesome. You'll enjoy them all.

It's never happened but it would be neat if it did. Lots of heavy packs out there. And I do go hiking. #128516; On overnights and multi days. And I'm not overweight since finding how much I love hiking. #128077;
Don't forget about insulation under you! Most likely in the form of a sleeping pad or underquilt.
No, two others beat me to it. :)

WRITING.TITLE: Fun times camping, Hocking hills, Ohio.

WRITING.TEXT: I liked it. Good luck!
What sleeping pad were you using? Was it insulated? A sleeping pad has been good down to the 40s for me. I use a kylmit static v insulated.
Depends on how you sleep I would think. I tend to get cool fast so I'd bring it no matter the temp.
I'd have to say that my kylmit static v insulated is really good. If you're going to be car camping try the static v luxe.

WRITING.TITLE: Neat rock formation, Rockbridge Falls.

WRITING.TEXT: Yea, we made a trip to Hocking Hills and saw this one, rock house and Conkle's hollow. I really didn't realize that Ohio has any as many neat nature stuff as it does.
I'm a fan of my OR Helium II. Really light and minimalistic.
Go bills!
Nailed it. #128077;

WRITING.TITLE: Staying dry in the rain while hammocking

WRITING.TEXT: Ha! I did! I was a little surprised myself when I felt it. But it was really pouring that night. From what I've seen I think the buckles could direct the stream of water toward the drip line depending on how much water is coming off.
Hear hear. I have a hard time imagining going to the ground if I need to.
You're welcome. Hope it helps someone

WRITING.TITLE: Hocking Hills, Ohio natural cave. A must see if you're close.
Conkle's Hollow in Hocking Hills

WRITING.TEXT: I'm not certain of the park rules. It's probably on the park website.

WRITING.TITLE: Hocking Hills day hike
The Great Smoky Mountains! Awesome backpacking trip
Part 2 of my GSMNP backpacking trip
[Wilderness] 3 day Smoky Mountains backpacking trip
My first multiday backpacking trip. Thanks for the inspiration guys and gals!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! The final two are coming up. It wasn't our first overnight but it was my first multiday.
It's definitely on "the list." We actually passed right by it on the way to the Smokies.

WRITING.TITLE: Cheap and handy tip for your tarp

WRITING.TEXT: Lol. Hammock forums idea. Thought it was worthy of a share.
I'd suggest reusing as a body scrubber. :) or a net of some kind. I can see using it for mushroom hunting as a breathable mesh bag.
That's a pretty broad question man. Lots of options out there. The two main ones I have are a Warbonnet xlc and a dream hammock.
The Fitbit app is reason enough. It's the same reason I keep with the iPhone. It's not the phone, it's the software (iOS).

If you're comfortable then it sounds like you're getting used to sleeping outside honestly. It still happens to me when I'm between trips. I usually take a non addictive sleep aid (OTC) for the first night just in case I need it. I usually don't but it's nice knowing I have it.
Yup I usually will have it up. Porch mode if it's nice out with no rain expected.
I see what you did there.

Yup, already preordered. Love the swappable bands for work, larger screen for notifications, splash water resistance and connected GPS. It's pretty much perfect for me. The only things left on my wish list are ridiculously long battery life, full waterproofing and GPS.
YES!! I thought I was missing something. The alarm is so weak compared to the charge HR. The HR alarm would wake me from a dead sleep. I'm a little afraid of missing this one.

On day 3 of the charge 2 here as well. LOVE it. Larger screen and notifications are great. So far I'm noticing the battery life is better than my HR even with connected GPS and notifications on (no all day sync). I've used the breathing session after a workout. Nothing to write home about. Just okay.

WRITING.TITLE: First time in Red River Gorge, KY. 3 day trip.

WRITING.TEXT: Well worth the trip! Of course, you also have the Smokies which is excellent backpacking.

Yea, you'll be pleased indeed. Be sure to check out Hanson's point. That alone made the whole trip worth while I think. Dolly Sods continues to elude me. Between weather and family illnesses I've had to cancel two trips already!

WRITING.TITLE: President Obama sent me a letter

WRITING.TEXT: They sent an autopenned proclamation with it and the signatures are different. But I'm no handwriting expert.

WRITING.TITLE: President Obama sent me a letter (x-posted /r pics)

WRITING.TEXT: I wish. :( it was a spur of the moment hand written note on legal pad paper. I thanked him for his support of the NPS, how important it was to me to preserve these areas for my kids. It was just after he created the National Monument in Maine.
Thanks! I think so too.
Ha! I read the rules. :)

It was just after he named the national monument in Maine so I thanked him for that and his support of the NPS. I also talked about how it was important to me for my kids to see and share my experiences in our national parks. I'm really kicking myself for not taking a picture of my letter.
Ha, I really wondered that myself. The letter responds to every area (I can remember) of my note. So I'd like to think it was heartfelt.
Thanks!
I will! I'm amazed at the response.

I wish I had taken a picture of it. I thanked him for his support of the NPS, he had just named the national monument in Maine. I also talked about how important it was to me to preserve land for my children to enjoy since I had amazing experiences in national parks.
Ha! That is true but I wonder what Bert Macklin would say.

You're the first person to ask me that. :) I did not support him as president and told him I was disappointed when he was elected. I went on to say that as the years have gone on I gained respect for him and I'm now proud that he was/is our president. (This is from memory). I had just gotten back from an amazing trip in the smoky mountains, saw our two options for president, saw he named a national monument in Maine, saw he was getting heat for it and felt patriotic. Thus, the letter I sent. :)
You're welcome! I've gained a great appreciation for our parks. Thanks for what you do.
Right?!
Will do!
very cool! You know the feeling to get a package next day air from the White House!
Nice!
Ha! This was my first letter to any president.
9x7, sent UPS next day air with cardboard backing.
Thanked him for his support of the NPS and how important it was to me that these lands be preserved for my kids to enjoy. It was just after he named the new national monument in Maine.
He had just named the Maine national monument. I thanked him for his support of the NPS and said I thought it was important that these lands be preserved for my children to enjoy and experience.
Yup, UPS next day air, with a copy of the NPS proclamation and cardboard backing.
Handwritten, spur of the moment letter. In general thanked him for support for the NPS and how important it was to preserve land for my kids to enjoy and experience.
People were against using executive power to do this. I believe a national monument is different from a national park which goes through congress.
It's tough to keep up but I'm refreshing my inbox as my kids play Mario on N64. :D
No worries, I'll still doubt it until an expert tells me for sure. I have the autopenned proclamation and the signature is different.
Thanks!
9x7 sent UPS next day air with the proclamation and cardboard backing.
I wrote him thanking him for his support of the NPS and how important it was to me to have my children enjoy and experience these lands. It was just after he named the national monument in Maine.
I think because it uses executive power and bypasses congress. That's why it's a monument and not a park.

No :( Spur of the moment hand written note. I'm kicking myself for not taking a pic of it. I basically thanked him for supporting the NPS and how important it was to me to preserve these lands and have my children enjoy and experience them. It was right after he named the new national monument in Maine.
The proclamation was about the NPS' 100 year anniversary. Autopenned means it was done by a machine and he didn't physically sign it.
UPS next day air. Sent with an NPS proclamation and cardboard backing. The letter is a 9x7.
A friend reminded me that I paid for that.

I don't have it. :( Spur of the moment hand written note. Thanking him for his support of the NPS and how important it was to preserve land for my children to enjoy and experience. It was right after he named the national monument in Maine.
:D markup editing on iPad.
Don't have it. :( Truly spur of the moment handwritten note. Thanking him for support of NPS and for preserving land for my children to enjoy and experience.
Have no idea what an A4 envelope is. It's a 9x7 that came UPS next day air. Had a copy of the proclamation with cardboard backing with it.
9x7, sent UPS next day air, enclosed with a copy of the NPS proclamation and cardboard backing.
I don't even remember the exact date. I think late August because it was just after he named the national monument in Maine.
It's a 9x7 that came next day air UPS with cardboard backing and a copy of the NPS proclamation.
I'm keeping it! :)
Thanks for the comment. I was/am really excited by his response.
9x7 UPS next day air, sent with a copy of the NPS proclamation and a cardboard backing.
I appreciate this comment. Thanks so much.
Ha, I'm still amazed I got this response.
Oh man, and your BBQ is fantastic!
Sweet! Enjoy!
Not old enough for grandkids. The kids liked it!
Verify the signature isn't autopenned. If it is autopenned then I'll frame it just because it's cool. If not autopenned I'll do some research on how best to preserve and frame it. Thanks!

I said this in another comment buried somewhere but I told him I didn't support him when he was elected. I told him I grew to respect him more as years have gone on and now I'm proud to call him my president (from memory).
It came UPS next day air. Envelope in a box.
Don't have it. :( Spur of the moment hand written note. Thanked him for his support of the NPS and how important it was to me to preserve these lands for my children.
I identify more with Ron Swanson but occasionally a bit of patriotism and civic responsibility peeks out.
Thanks for the comment, that's what I think too. They included an autopenned proclamation and the signatures are different.
UPS next day air. Huge envelope with cardboard backing in a box.
What, you got a friend who you want to check the letter out?
It's a 9x7 (rough measurement). Sent UPS next day air. Huge envelope with cardboard backing in a box.
Ha, yes it was handwritten. I always like getting handwritten letters because it's more personal to me.
That is cool!
It was a handwritten note and unfortunately no pic.
I sent my letter at the end of August. So a little over two months?
I wrote him late August. Just a guess based on when he named the Maine national monument. So a little over two months.
Large Manila envelope. Nothing fancy. It came next day air and was in UPS box.
No, that's just the markup editing tool on the iPad. :)
No sorry, it was a handwritten note. No copy. :(
Haha, that's the markup editing tool on my iPad. Real letter is intact. :)
Not a handwriting expert but I have an autopenned proclamation for the NPS in the same envelope and the signature is different.
Yup, it's also a 9x7 (approx). Sent UPS next day air with NPS proclamation and a cardboard backing.
I used the editing tool on my iPad. Real letter is intact. :)
Thanked him for his support of the NPS and how important it was to me that these lands be preserved for my kids.
I assumed it's the embossing.
It's a 9x7 that was sent UPS next day air with the NPS proclamation and a cardboard backing. No folds.
Thanked him for his support of the NPS and how important it was to me that these lands are preserved for my children to experience.
Don't have it. It was a handwritten note. :(
Source? Unless you're referring to the temporary government shutdown...which I agree was silly.
I appreciate the advice. I don't know about worth but I do want to make sure I preserve it, especially if an expert agrees it's not autopenned.
Now that is an excellent idea! Thanks so much. I'll probably email them and attach the letter they/he sent. Someone reads it.
:D markup editing tool on the iPad fooled a bunch of people. Letter is intact. :)

WRITING.TITLE: Nothing quite like the Smoky Mountains in Fall

WRITING.TEXT: We were in the NE section of the park. It was lows in the 30s when we went. We used hammocks for the second night and shelter the first night. During the day hiking was perfect. Not too hot or cold. There are adequate water sources even with the drought but be aware that you should full up whenever you see a source. We carried 2 liters and were fine. Fire ban still in effect when went. Large parts of NC and TN were on fire.
This is an ancient post in internet time BUT what purpose would that possibly serve? I assumed the wavy look was from the embosser used above "The White House."

WRITING.TITLE: Epic Great Smoky Mountains backpacking

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! It was a tough one. I thought Baxter Creek Trail would never end.

WRITING.TITLE: So I was reading the ingredient label on my broom...
First time hiking in Florida: Black Bear Wilderness Area reminds me of Dagobah

WRITING.TEXT: Right? One of my favorite shots from the loop on Wednesday.
There is a nice campsite there. Lots of good hammock spots.
Just some wetland birds and a TON of squirrel. :D
Lol, I check that box on the forms sometimes. But not Vietnamese. :)
Nope.
Yup, that's it.
Deet based spray was a must have.
Well done sir.
Thanks. There most definitely are alligators there. Your fear seems completely rational to me. #128518;
Very little. Granted I sprayed with deet based spray beforehand.
Yup from the 28th of December.

I would suggest Red River Gorge in Kentucky. You could easily spend a lifetime exploring the official and unofficial trails in the area. Just bring a good map for the unofficial trails. Hanson's Point, Cloudsplitter, Indian Staircase are excellent unofficial sites. Maps I would suggest http://www.outragegis.com/gorge/ for detailed topo maps.
Wow that is truly epic. Nice pic man!
Yes, I don't pay any attention to Fitbit calories or food.

WRITING.TITLE: EMSK: How to tie the clove hitch (camping knot)

WRITING.TEXT: My enlightened equipment top quilt. Pricey but so worth it. No more restrictive mummy bag and way lighter.
Excellent response. I agree as well. #128077;
Yes, but then I also have the exos 58. #128516; Great pack!
I'm a fan of paria outdoors 15 degree (-9c) bags. Works well and good cost/weight/warmth. https://www.pariaoutdoorproducts.com/collections/products/products/thermodown-15-sleeping-bag

I don't have a specific hammock in mind but I would suggest getting a longer hammock (11 ft) rather than the standard 10 ft. You most likely will feel more comfortable and be able to get a flatter lay. If you buy a no net hammock then you can get a mosquito sock/net later but it won't "attach" to your existing hammock and you'll need a ridgeline to keep it off your face. I would suggest watching a ton of YouTube videos about the basics of hammock hanging. Shugemery (Shug) on YouTube has a great series for beginners. And he's hilarious. I'm personally not a fan of bear butt hammocks. Seems like they've had a huge marketing push recently. I like hobo hammocks better (on Amazon). But neither are 11 feet I think.

Yes, I did exactly what you describe while saving (and waiting) for an underquilt. I did use an insulated pad though. I still plan on doing it if I'm going somewhere there may not be good hanging tree so I can go to the ground (gasp) if I need to. You stay plenty warm as long as you're on the pad.
Between these two I'd choose the first. The lack of zippered pockets would bother me but the lack of down second one would bother me more. Also, the first one is lighter. ETA: don't you want a hood?

WRITING.TITLE: Good starter hammock from Warbonnet on massdrop

WRITING.TEXT: Yea, it's the Warbonnet traveler. Netless hammock.
Lol, they were already bashed about it in the discussion.
I'm 6'1" and 11 ft works well for me. I'd assume it'd be fine for you as well.
Beautiful area. I used to drive from Pueblo to Trinidad frequently.

WRITING.TITLE: [For Sale] Warbonnet Blackbird XLC with winter top cover
WRITING.TEXT: I have too many hammocks so this awesome one has to go. Bought in March 2016 and been out maybe 5 times. It's double layer 1.7, has the buckle and webbing system and winter top cover. Absolutely nothing wrong with it, in perfect condition. $250 shipped to the lower 48. Color: Olive green Weight capacity: 400 LBS Item weight (webbing/buckles): 2 lb. 7oz. Fabric: 1.7oz/70D Nylon (x2) http://tinypic.com/r/2q0onix/9
Sure, I didn't vote for him.

WRITING.TITLE: [Dinner] The Ramen bomb: my go-to rib sticking trail meal

WRITING.TEXT: Lol, I discovered my mistake soon after and separated them.
Depends on how much you use and brand but it's about 700 calories. The calorie count to weight ratio is why I started doing this. Added to the fact that it's delicious.
Nope, at least not by me.

Ha, I still do. Check out the humangear duo. That's what I carry now. The utensil in the video is called sprongs. I hate sporks but I do like being able to scoop peanut butter or soups with a spoon AND the utility of a fork for eggs, stabbing pieces of meat etc. sooooo, I carry both.
Meh, I only do it a handful of times a year. Do you not use mountain house meals ever? Ziplock freezer bags don't concern as much as eating ramen and spam long term. #128514;

Depends on your price range of course. But I'm always surprised more people don't order the Dream Hammock Darien. Quality product. Stick to bare bones for a little over $100 and it's custom made. You choose the color!
Lower falls?
No pads but I assume it needs underinsulation of some kind?
Those things are great. I use one as my summer top quilt.

I second this. RRG is a great area to backpack. If you're a beginner stick to the official trails for a bit but there's lots to explore.
